title: There Was Probably a Flashover in the Swiss Bar Fire. Here’s What That Means.
summary: A flashover is an event where an entire room is rapidly engulfed in flames.

title: Survivor Recounts Moment He Caught Fire in Swiss Bar
summary: Noa Bersier went to Le Constellation with friends on a whim. An hour later, he was caught in one of Switzerland’s worst tragedies.

title: Mamdani Revokes Executive Orders That Adams Signed to Support Israel
summary: Former Mayor Eric Adams and some conservative-leaning Jewish leaders criticized the revocation of his executive orders, one of which he signed just last month.

title: Images From the Dawn of the Mamdani Era
summary: Thousands of New Yorkers packed the plaza ouside City Hall and the streets of Lower Manhattan to see Mayor Zohran Mamdani take office.

title: Following Mamdani’s Win, Souvenir Shops Look to Cash In
summary: Seemingly overnight, T-shirts with the likeness of the new mayor have become common in New York City.

title: Trump Says U.S. Will Intervene if Iran Kills Protesters
summary: Mr. Trump’s remarks that he was ready to come to the protesters’ “rescue” are a sharp escalation as protests over economic hardship turned deadly.

title: A Study Is Retracted, Renewing Concerns About the Weedkiller Roundup
summary: Problems with a 25-year-old landmark paper on the safety of Roundup’s active ingredient, glyphosate, have led to calls for the E.P.A. to reassess the widely used chemical.

title: Welcome to the Office. Now Take Off Your Shoes.
summary: Some start-ups, blurring the lines between home and office, are embracing a “no shoes” policy.

title: 50 Years Ago, He Was an Olympian. At 80, He’s Just as Happy to Finish Last.
summary: Jeff Galloway, who popularized the run-walk-run method, is determined to complete one more marathon.

title: After Watergate, the Presidency Was Tamed. Trump Is Unleashing It.
summary: In the 1970s, Congress passed a raft of laws to hold the White House accountable. President Trump has decided they don’t apply to him.

title: With Obamacare’s Higher Premiums Come Difficult Decisions
summary: As enhanced subsidies expire, many Americans covered under the Affordable Care Act are having trouble paying for insurance.

title: Tesla Car Sales Dropped 9% in 2025, Falling Behind China’s BYD
summary: As the largest maker of electric vehicles in the United States, Tesla suffered more than other carmakers from the elimination of federal incentives.

title: As Schools Embrace A.I. Tools, Skeptics Raise Concerns
summary: More governments are rolling out chatbots in schools. Some experts warn the tools could erode teaching and learning.

title: In China, A.I. Finds Pancreatic Cancer That Doctors May Miss
summary: A tool for spotting pancreatic cancer in routine CT scans has had promising results, one example of how China is racing to apply A.I. to medicine’s tough problems.

title: Why a Nuclear Plant Is a Big Sticking Point in the Ukraine Peace Plan
summary: The Zaporizhzhia plant, occupied by Russia, would be crucial to powering Ukraine’s postwar recovery.

title: Ukraine’s Zelensky Names Kyrylo Budanov as New Chief of Staff
summary: Kyrylo Budanov, who has served as Ukraine’s military intelligence chief, is seen as a potential rival to Mr. Zelensky if elections are held.

title: Bacterial Vaginosis Is No Longer Thought to Affect Only Women
summary: Gynecologists long viewed bacterial vaginosis as solely a women’s issue — until a study that treated their male partners, too, proved otherwise.

title: So You Have Bacterial Vaginosis. What Do You Do Now?
summary: Now that the condition is known to spread sexually, there are steps you and your partner can take to prevent it.

title: Carrying for a Cause: Meet the Man Lugging Shelter Dogs Around New York
summary: Bryan Reisberg built a social media following in the millions by carrying his corgi, Maxine, in a backpack. Now, he carries shelter dogs.

title: Trump Is the Jan. 6 President
summary: Tragically, America is still living in a political era that began on Jan. 6, 2021.

title: The American Dream Is Alive in Zohran Mamdani
summary: The mayor’s résumé looks like the broad coalition he built when he swept to victory in November.

title: Why Do Americans Hate A.I.?
summary: We look at the uniquely American animosity toward artificial intelligence.

title: North Carolina Man Accused of Planning Potential Terrorist Attack
summary: The 18-year-old, radicalized online, was planning a New Year’s Eve attack in a Charlotte suburb, officials said.

title: Wall Street Sees Another Banner Year for Markets. Could Anything Stop It?
summary: Analysts have forecast more stellar gains for the S&P 500. But concerns about inflation, the dollar and sky-high valuations could make for a choppy run.

title: New Laws Going Into Effect for New York in 2026
summary: Among them, benefits for minimum wage workers, cancer patients and parents of young children. Also, a change to child abuse reporting.

title: Yemen Sends Its Military to Push Out Separatist Faction
summary: The Saudi-backed government in Yemen said it would send forces to reclaim territory from a group that the United Arab Emirates supports.
